intro: Anotites dorrii, commonly known as the dwarf pomegranate, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, spiny fruit. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand harsh, dry conditions. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Anotites dorrii is notable for its unique appearance and is considered a rare and endemic species.
